quote-text: That points to the PAP’s other problem: one of substance. To the apparent disbelief of party leaders, many Singaporeans actually seem unhappy with government policy. Two related bugbears keep coming up: the cost of living and immigration. Many poorer Singaporeans feel their wages are depressed by an influx of workers from low-wage countries, such as Bangladesh and, above all, China. Singaporeâs social safety net offers a bare minimum and all Singaporean men are conscripted for two yearsâ national service. Immigrants are seen as enjoying special privileges.
quote-source: Banyan, The limits to dialogue, The Economist, February 2, 2013. I should also point out that I literally cheered in the street when I heard Alex Au mentioned in The Economist. Here is his wonderful blog.
